brief_summary.textblock:
Saudi Arabia has been named by the International Diabetes Federation as among the top ten
      countries with highest prevalence of diabetes. Women are said to have overall prevalence
      twice that for men. With high birth rate in the country we decided to look at the impact of
      diabetic pregnancies on their off-springs

clinical_study.brief_title: Infants of Diabetic Mothers: A Cohort Study

detailed_description.textblock:
Diabetics are followed regularly in diabetic outpatient clinics where dietary and medical
      management are offered. Diabetic pregnancies are managed by a team consisting of
      diabetologist, obstetrician, feto-maternal obstetrician and dietician.

      Management of these pregnancies depends on whether these women have pre-gestational or
      gestational diabetes. Very few diabetic women have exposure to preconceptual advice. For
      this reason we opted to find out the outcome of infants of diabetic mothers compared to
      those mothers who are essentially normal with no associated medical or obstetric disorders.
      Equally we wanted to see if there are differences in the outcome of infants born to
      pre-gestational and gestational diabetic mothers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:All infants born to diabetic mothers

          -  Infants born to mothers with normal pregnancies

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Infants born to mothers with other medical disorders before or during pregnancy which
             may affect the newborn

study_pop.textblock: All Infants of diabetic mothers born at security Forces Hospital, Riyadh

intervention.description: strict glycemic control in diabetic pregnancies
intervention.intervention_name: Prevention of complications in infants of diabetic mothers

clinical_study.official_title: Study of Outcome of Infants of Diabetic Mothers in a Tertiary Hospital Set up

other_outcome.description: To assess incidence of preterm birth in infants of diabetic mothers
To assess the need of infants of diabetic mothers for admission to neonatal intensive care
other_outcome.measure: Admission to neonatal intensive care unit

primary_outcome.description: Assess presence of congenital malformations in infants of diabetic mothers
primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of first clinical examination

reference.citation: Persson M, Norman M, Hanson U. Obstetric and perinatal outcomes in type 1 diabetic pregnancies: A large, population-based study. Diabetes Care. 2009 Nov;32(11):2005-9. doi: 10.2337/dc09-0656. Epub 2009 Aug 12.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Yang J, Cummings EA, O'connell C, Jangaard K. Fetal and neonatal outcomes of diabetic pregnancies. Obstet Gynecol. 2006 Sep;108(3 Pt 1):644-50.

secondary_outcome.description: To assess the length of hospital stay for infants of diabetic mothers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge from hospital or death

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
